text.p: These are the leading stories in the Beirut press on Monday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
-Prime Minister Hariri will meet Syrian President Assad in Damascus today to discuss the results of "Friends of Lebanon" conference which was held in Washington last Monday.

-Christian Maronite Patriarch Sfeir questioned the legality of a recent widespread detention campaign carried out by security forces after gunmen killed one Syrian worker in an attack on a Syrian van on Wednesday in the Christian area of Tabarja north of Beirut.
-Israeli forces launched an arrest campain against villagers in the south Lebanon occuppation zone.
-The first issue of "The Beirut Times", a new English-language Lebanese newspaper will appear beginning of January.
-The pro-Iranian Hizbollah (party of God) chief Sheikh Nasrallah said a possible new Israeli blitz would aim at forcing Lebanon to surrender.
-Three people were killed in a car accident in Mount Lebanon.
-The consolidated balance sheet of commercial banks rose in October, The Banks Assossiation said.
